I am 14 years old and had been a long time (about 4 or 5 years) I did not want to hear about that game. I was a subscriber the Club for years, totally addicted and too loved this game, but when I stopped playing I ended up with this. But a few years ago I went back to listen to some music of our DJ Cadence and started to enjoy it again. And then hearing "Cool in the Cold" (I saw the release of the song in 2012) and remembered that every year I donated to the Coins for Change. I still do not own an interest in the game, but I can not break my promise of donating the MAXIMUM than I can donate every year. Always, on the weeks of December, I play all the possible games to earn coins and donate the last coin by the campaign. I love it!!

While I love Club Penguin, non-members can't do anything on there. It just now happened a couple months ago that members were able to get decent clothing. Non-members can only have 2 puffles, while members are able to get an unlimited number of puffles. They are also able to take better care of them because they have more available resources such as beds and food trays. Eventually club penguin will loose majority if their players since 2/3 of players are non-members, and they are being treated this way. Not everybody can afford to buy continuous months of membership. This also goes for Animal Jam, only Animal Jam is worse than this.

Don't forget (this is more about the paid members problem than the idea btw)!

"I have a statement! Me and some of my friends and family play Club Penguin, and most of us have been paid members, but can't afford it anymore. Now we can't use the stuff we could have as a paid member. I know paid members are very helpful when it comes to money, but if we have been paying that, and can't anymore, why can't we have our stuff back?

Also! I have an idea for he game! We can send post cards to our friends, but it would also be cool if we could send gifts to each other! Even members to non-members. Like, stuff they aren't using of course. Just an idea! Anyway, please let us former paid members get our stuff back! Thanks!

(I won't stop till I'm recognized)."

I had purchased a membership which I showed proof of and did not receive that membership. I called Club Penguin support and was told that there was a glitch on their end and that I would be receiving the membership which I paid for. 3 days later I received an email stating that I would not be receiving the membership due to problems on their end. I did not get a response to my email back to them so I called. I was on the phone for 40 mins before I was transferred to the Supervisor "Amber". I asked to speak with the person above her and she hung up on me. I called back and was hung up on by "Serie". I called again and was hung up on by "Katrina". I called again and was hung up on by "Amber" who said I wasn't allowed to speak with her manager. I never received my membership and was completely scammed. *****PLEASE PASS THIS ALONG SO THAT IT DOESN'T HAPPEN TO ANYONE ELSE*****
